answerText: bubble chambers[10] Bubble chambers can be used to determine the ratio of charge to this quantity for the particles. Newton's laws give this quantity as force divided by acceleration.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | VCU A + Dorman HS  | 13 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The inventor of these devices stated in 2006 that he used beer to fill early versions of them, though liquid hydrogen eventually became the accepted fluid. For 10 points each: [10] Name these physical devices invented by Donald Glaser, which are used to view ionization tracks left behind by charged particles. Unlike their supersaturated-vapor counterparts, these devices use superheated liquid.
